page.title: 01REVIEW OF BLOCK 0480 0405
page.content: OUR BLOCK CONSISTS OF MAINLY ARABLE FARMLAND.THERE ARE FOUR SETTLEMENTS AND A FEW ISOLATED FARMS.IN THE BLOCK THERE IS ONLY ONE SCHOOL,WHICH HAS 43 CHILDREN ON ROLL BETWEEN THE AGES OF 4 AND 11.OTHER CHILDREN IN OUR BLOCK BETWEEN THESE AGES GO TO EITHER BELTON PRIMARY SCHOOL OR MESSINGHAM PRIMARY SCHOOL,BEFORE GOING TO A COMPREHENSIVE AT EPWORTH OR SCUNTHORPE.THERE ARE FOUR PLACES OF WORSHIP;TWO CHURCH OF ENGLAND AND TWO METHODISTS.THREE SMALL INDUSTRIES ARE BASED AT WEST BUTTERWICK.THE BUTTERWICKS WERE SITUATED ON THE RIVER TRENT AT THE SITE OF A FERRY.WEST BUTTERWICK BELONGED FORMERLY TO THE SHEFFIELD FAMILY WHO MOVED TO NORMANBY PARK IN 1658.LORD SHEFFIELD WAS INSTRUMENTAL IN THE BUILDING OF THE CHURCH AND HE ALSO PROVIDED THE LAND FOR THE SCHOOL.
